IncidentDef.label: incapacitated refugee quest
IncidentDef.letterText:
{PAWN_nameDef} contacts you and requests help. {PAWN_pronoun} is wounded and unable to move. Without your help, {PAWN_pronoun} will die in {0} days.

{PAWN_nameDef} is a {1}-year-old {2}. {PAWN_pronoun} promises to join you if you rescue {PAWN_objective}.

{PAWN_nameDef} says that {3}.

IncidentDef.label: prisoner rescue quest
IncidentDef.letterText: A prisoner being held by {0} has managed to steal a radio and call you!\n\n{PAWN_nameDef} is being held at a camp nearby under armed guard. Rescue {PAWN_objective}, and {PAWN_pronoun} will join your colony. {PAWN_pronoun} is a {1}-year-old {2}. {PAWN_pronoun} says that {3}.

IncidentDef.label: wanderer join
IncidentDef.letterText: A {PAWN_kind} named {PAWN_nameDef} has arrived and is joining the colony. {PAWN_pronoun} is a {PAWN_title}.\n\n[PAWN_pronoun] is willing to contribute, but will not leave voluntarily. If you don't want {PAWN_nameDef}, you can banish {PAWN_objective}, sell {PAWN_objective} into slavery, or simply kill {PAWN_objective}. However, your other colonists may find this disturbing.

IncidentDef.label: wild man wanders in
IncidentDef.letterText: A person living among wild animals has wandered into the area. {PAWN_pronoun}'s called {0}.\n\nYou can attempt to tame or arrest {PAWN_objective}.
